title: Riot logic on Mordekaiser
body:
Okay, so when DFG was removed (Rest In Peace) Riot stated that Veigar and Mordekaiser would be weak, so they Nerfed morde and made veigar harder to play. Mordekaiser was made WEAKER with the removal of DFG so riot lowered his base HP regen, lowered the damage on his w and didn't really do anything to help him all that much (His w gives him movement speed towards the target, this would help him to escape ganks but the time it takes to get to the minion (Usually walking towards him) is the same time it takes to walk towards it normally, With no mobility he can't risk using his ult on most champions in the game because of their high mobility. He is being forced into more of a tank role now than an ap battle mage, In my opinion being a tank with no cc makes you almost useless, you can't peel for your team if you just get ignored and with his average base damage without ap or magic penetration you get ignored by all but the softest of the enemy, How are you ment to be a tank for you team if they just jump over you to your carrys? As a mage he used to be able to burst with his ult and DFG combo after he burned both of those he became a sustained damage dealer with his pet and his base abilities but without DFG to go with his ult he can no longer burst an adc down fast enough before being cc locked, poked back or the adc life steals back to enough hp (It was hard enough to get within range of the adc in the first place). Mordekaiser was one of the first champs I played when I started this game in the start of season 3, I love this champion but I don't understand what he is meant to be in his current state, a tank with no cc, a mage with low range and limited burst or a sustained damage dealer with low range, no gap closers, no cc and no mobility? I am bronze but that doesn't mean my opinion is worthless.

tl;dr - The removal of DFG nerfed mordekaiser, riot then nerfed him again afterwards even though they said they would give them "a little love", he is now hardly able to burst as an AP mage and as a tank he has no cc making him un-able to peel. Not viable anymore in current meta and riot need to learn that not all love needs to hurt.

Stew52

replies.body:
Dont forget the ghost nerfs.

Before his ghost would receive 75% of Mord's AP, which in turn would boost his own further (Giving Mordekaiser around 15% of his AP). Since his ghost doesnt gain AP anymore, Morde wont receive the boost unless his target built AP to begin with.

Ghost would also receive 75% of Mord's AD, but now it gains a flat bomus (25/50/100). This is a nerf to his early and mid game, while being a small buff to his late _if_ he didnt build a Gunblade.


Seriously, Mord and Veigar's compensation nerfed them harder than Zed's nerf lol

Honestly to me the ghost changes were good.  You are no longer relegated to ulting the enemy ADC.  You could take the enemy APC (more AP) or tank (more HP) now and they can still hit people for damage since he buffs their AD.

But heres the thing, you always could take any ghost as Mord.

APCs would provide you with even more AP than currently because before, the ghost would get some of Mordekaiser's AP. Mord also got AD from APCs, which was nice.

ADCs would also get Mordekaiser's AP, which means he is getting AP and AD.

Before, Mord would get at least 15% of his Total AP as a bonus just for gaining a ghost. Now he needs to ult a mage.


Mord also used to give 75% of his AD to a ghost, which is greater than the current flat 25 at level 6 and 50 at level 11. Ghost only gets more AD at level 16, but only if he didnt build a Gunblade.

You could take any damage dealer as a ghost as Morde.  Now you are actually rewarded for ulting the tank with more than just extra healing.  Also, APCs can give you more now since they grant 30% of their AP now, and they probably build more than you do since you usually have to spend a bit on not getting blown up.  Also, how often do you build Gunblade on Morde?

I will agree that he isn't rewarded quite as much for ulting the enemy ADC as he used to be, but I like that.  I enjoy knowing that if I ult the tank for a big heal and a lot of Max HP shred I didn't waste it.  I enjoy feeling like ulting the enemy ADC isn't always the best option.  That and it also makes more sense that he isn't getting AP from someone who had none.
True.
But lowered health cost? That lets you spam your abilities more and keep the shield up.
The health costs were lowered but not to the point to justify taking his hp regen from almost 9 per 5 to about 3 per 5.
Lowered health cost is also not the compensation he needed for losing DFG.
They didnt lower the cost of his E, aka, the spell you use the most in lane.
They lowered the cost of his Q and W, which were never spammed in the first place.

As someone who never built a DFG on Morde even before it was to be removed, he really didn't need it.  He has always been a sustained, AoE, AP damage machine and the changes didn't actually change that.  Yes, the changes weren't great for him.  However, if you are willing to adapt, you can come out better off from it.  I did [the math](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/83QNaaX6-mordes-hp5-is-ridiculously-low-for-a-health-based-caster?comment=000c) and he loses less hp per minute than old Morde if you switch to maxing Q first.  Sure, Q might not be as optimum as E for damage and harass, but it is a better first max currently because of the health cost changes.

Also, I don't remember a single meta where he was considered viable (except sorta in the assassin meta, since he could counter most of them in lane).

I would love for them to return a bit of his HP/5, but he is still a good top lane pick (haven't spent enough time in mid to say anything about that) and giving him buffs might push him over the edge.
Even with E max you still lose less hp.
I don't see how you figured that.  They didn't reduce the E cost, they reduced his HP/5 by 5 and the cost of Q was only reduced by 5 on an 8 second cooldown.  How are you losing less hp?
You will still be using Q and W in lane.
Yes, but the cost reductions don't fully compensate for that.  I did the math, you come out 4.5 hp less per minute than old Morde if you max E first.

You should be rushing a hextech, and should also have the hp per 5 masteries.

You lose far less hp in the long run. Maxing Q over E is foolish. You pretty much give up your laning phase for a few less potions.

The ends justify the means. The morde changes overall were a buff.

Rushing Hextech doesn't really apply here, once you get that health costs are irrelevant.  The masteries/runes also don't matter because you could have those on old Morde and whether you max E or Q or even W first on new Morde.

You have higher base damage over time with Q max first (50/sec as opposed to 41.7/sec, unless you get single target damage then it is 82.5 to 41.7), so if you trade with an opponent regularly (say, every time Q is up) then you will do more with Q than E.  Yes, E can do more total damage to a wave and hits from a range, but if you are against a melee then that isn't really worth the lower damage and greater health costs.  If you are against a ranged then go with whichever you prefer.

Ends can justify means, but I don't see how that applies.  Also, I effectively did say the changes were a buff:  "you can come out better off from it".

Morde was signifgantly buffed with dfg removal.

That movement speed on W, the removal of cast time on W, the lowered health costs, and increased ult effectiveness (YES IT WAS A BUFF USE MATH), and the increased range on Q are far worth the loss of the hp regen.

His winrate represents this. It is up 5% from what it was post dfg removal, even higher depending on the site you use.
They never lowered his base regen after the dfg removal, where did you find that change? They lowered his health costs and they did nerf his w a bit and the ult ghost that is true.

riot should immediatly back up the game to season 2, it was the best season.

The issue is that Riot basically looked at Morde as having a power budget that was the same as more commonly picked Mages/AP Bruisers.

Compare him to, say, Rumble (probably one of the closest comparisons I can think of in terms of AP Bruisers) with money to represent his power budget.

Rumble:
Total Budget - $1000
Passive - $100
Q - $250
W - $150
E - $200
R - $300

Mordekaiser:
Total Budget Allowance - $750
Passive - $100
Q - $75
W - $125
E - $200
R - $250

When Riot *changed* Mordekaiser, they didn't give him the $250 he was missing that he rightfully deserved, they took money from one part of his kit and put it somewhere else.
He said riot and logic in the same post, lol
